questions.text: Some species of hummingbird can beat their wings 60-70 times a second.
questions.explanation:
True.

	Their wings make a humming sound and that's how they got their name.

True.

	Oftentimes they are so small and so fast that they are hard to see.

questions.text: These birds have long bills so that they can reach deep into the ground or into tight spaces to get bugs.
questions.explanation:
False.

	They are long so that they can get deep into flowers and get the sweet stuff.

questions.text: The Cuban bee hummingbird is the smallest form of this bird?
questions.explanation:
True.

	It is only two and a fourth inches long.

questions.text: Their favorite color seems to be...
These birds feed 50-60 times a day.
questions.explanation:
True.

	Their busy wings burn food fast.

questions.text: Most hummingbirds migrate south for the winter.
questions.explanation:
False.

	Many of them are far too dainty to stay too far north for a harsh winter. Some, depending on where they live, do not have to go too far south. Where they live may already be warm enough, such as Southern California.

questions.text: They build their nests on the ground.
They wrap their nests with silk from either spiders or caterpillars.
They usually only lay one egg per nest.
questions.explanation:
False.

	They almost always lay two.
